item.title: Quick & Cozy Vegetable Soup in 30 Minutes
item.description: A straightforward vegetable soup that's actually done in 30 minutes, with bright vegetables in a broth that tastes like it simmered for hours. Perfect for weeknight dinners or prepping ahead for the week.
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 10 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 20 minutes

â° Total Time: N/A minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 4

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • 1 medium onion, chopped
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 2 carrots, diced
  • 2 stalks celery, diced
  • 1 bell pepper, chopped
  • 1 zucchini, diced
  • 1 can (14.5 oz) diced tomatoes, with juice
  • 4 cups vegetable broth
  • 1 teaspoon dried oregano
  • 1 teaspoon thyme
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Fresh parsley for garnish

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Once it shimmers, add the chopped onion and cook for about 3 minutes, stirring occasionally. You're looking for the onion to soften and turn translucent at the edges.
  2. Add the minced garlic, carrots, and celery. Stir everything together and cook for 5 minutes. The garlic should perfume the entire kitchenâ€”that's when you know it's releasing its flavor properly.
  3. Stir in the bell pepper and zucchini, then pour in the canned tomatoes with their liquid. Add the vegetable broth and increase the heat to bring everything to a gentle boil. This should take about 2-3 minutes.
  4. Once you see the broth simmering, reduce the heat to medium-low. Let it cook for 10-15 minutes. The vegetables should be tender enough to cut easily with a spoon, but still holding their shape and color.
  5. Add the dried oregano and thyme, stirring well. Taste the broth and add salt and pepper graduallyâ€”you want to build the seasoning, not overpower it. Let it simmer another 2-3 minutes to let the herbs fully infuse.
  6. Ladle the soup into bowls and top each serving with fresh chopped parsley. Serve while it's hot; the vegetables will continue to soften slightly as it cools.
